item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/communicating-while-submissive-in-full/#comment-1049">Tilari</a>.
Thank you for reminding readers of this possibility. Setting aside time to check in with each other in a power-neutral way is often recommended, so I'm guessing it works really well for a lot of people. I must be the odd one out. :) If I feel like Person X has authority over me, then it is always hard to tell them things they might not like to hear, but I literally don't know how to do it in a power-neutral way. I can prostrate myself or brat, but polite vanilla doesn't seem to be an option that's available to me in those relationships. But definitely everyone should do whatever works best for them!

item.title: By: Tilari
item.dc:creator: Tilari
item.description:
One method that my Captain and I use for communication is setting aside time for a service/relationship/etc check-in. This time can be requested by either myself or my Captain, and the first free time we have goes to it. One difference our check-in has from some of the methods you've described is that we intentionally create a power-neutral space so we're communicating on an equal level, which, come to think of it, may make this completely off-topic from the point of your post. :P
But I figured I'd chip in my two cents on another communication option in a power exchange relationship. :)
